title: PolNet-CR: Spatial-channel collaborative interaction network for PolSAR incremental information-assisted optical satellite imagery cloud removal
authors: **Jiangong Xu**, Xiaoyu Yu, Jun Pan, Liwen Cao, Mi Wang
abs: Key Words: Cloud removal; Interaction learning; Image reconstruction; Multimodal fusion network; Polarimetric SAR (PolSAR)
introduction: Reconstructing cloud-contaminated optical satellite images is vital for continuous monitoring. Despite PolSAR fusion advances, challenges like imaging gaps, speckle noise, and underused polarization hinder quality. This paper proposes PolNet-CR, a spatial-channel collaborative network with cross-scale aggregation, sparse channel optimization, and incremental collaboration for adaptive cross-domain feature fusion. A new dataset, LuojiaSET-PolCR, with PolSAR scattering features is introduced. Experiments show PolNet-CR surpasses existing methods, enabling high-fidelity, cloud-free imagery for seamless observation.
